info.title: Digitraffic Marine API
info.description:
[OpenAPI document](/swagger/openapi.json) 

Digitraffic is a service operated by the [Fintraffic](https://www.fintraffic.fi) offering real time traffic information. Currently the service covers *road, marine and rail* traffic. More information can be found at the [Digitraffic website](https://www.digitraffic.fi/) 

The service has a public Google-group [meri.digitraffic.fi](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/meridigitrafficfi) for communication between developers, service administrators and Fintraffic. The discussion in the forum is mostly in Finnish, but you're welcome to communicate in English too. 

### General notes of the API
* Many Digitraffic APIs use GeoJSON as data format. Definition of the GeoJSON format can be found at https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946.
* For dates and times [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format is used with "Zulu" zero offset from UTC unless otherwise specified (i.e., "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.mmm]Z"). E.g. 2019-11-01T06:30:00Z.

license.name: Digitraffic is an open data service. All content from the service and the service documentation is licenced under the Creative Commons 4.0 BY license.

get.summary: Return all active faults in GeoJSON

parameters.name: fixed_in_hours
parameters.description: Show faults that are unfixed or were fixed at most this many hours ago (default 7 days).  Must be between 0 and 2400

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language: en, fi or sv (default en)

200.description: Successful retrieval of winter navigation vessels

parameters.name: vesselId
parameters.description: Vessel identification code. Equals IMO-{IMO-code} when vessel IMO is present. Otherwise MMSI-{MMSI-code} (Maritime Mobile Service Identity).

200.description: Successful retrieval of a winter navigation vesse√∂
Successful retrieval of winter navigation ports

parameters.name: locode
parameters.description: Port locode

200.description: Successful retrieval of a winter navigation port
Successful retrieval of winter navigation dirways

get.summary: Return Sea State Estimation (SSE) data as GeoJSON.  If from/to parameters are given, returs measurements from history, otherwise returns the latest measurements

parameters.name: siteNumber
parameters.description: SSE site number

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Return SSE data after given time in ISO date format {yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ} e.g. 2019-06-01T01:30:00.000Z

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Return SSE data before given time in ISO date format {yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ} e.g. 2019-06-30T01:30:00.000Z

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Return details of vessels whose metadata has changed after given time in ISO date format {yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ} e.g. 2016-10-31T06:30:00.000Z. Default value is now minus 24 hours if all parameters are empty.

parameters.name: vesselName
parameters.description: Return vessel details for given vessel name

parameters.name: mmsi
parameters.description: Return vessel details for given mmsi

parameters.name: imo
parameters.description: Return vessel details for given IMO/LLOYDS

parameters.name: nationality
parameters.description: Return vessel details for vessels with given nationality or nationalities (e.g. FI)

parameters.name: vesselTypeCode
parameters.description: Return vessel details for given vessel type code

get.summary: Return all ports with port areas and berths.
Return one port with port areas and berths by SafeSeaNet location code (locode).

get.description:
If the search result size exceeds 1000 items, the operation will return an error, and thus try to narrow down your search criteria to limit the result size below 1000 items.

Data is provided as is and isn't moderated in any way. Timestamps are in valid ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2016-10-31 or 2016-10-31T06:30:00.000Z, but may still contain anomalies such as the timestamp being in distant future.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Return port calls received on given date.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Return port calls received after given time. Default value is now minus 24 hours if all parameters are empty.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Return port calls received before given time.Default value is now plus 100 days, if parameter is empty.

parameters.name: etaFrom
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ETA time is after the given time

parameters.name: etdFrom
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ETD time is after the given time

parameters.name: ataFrom
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ATA time is after the given time

parameters.name: atdFrom
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ATD time is after the given time

parameters.name: etaTo
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ETA time is before the given time

parameters.name: etdTo
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ETD time is before the given time

parameters.name: ataTo
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ATA time is before the given time

parameters.name: atdTo
parameters.description: Return port calls whose ATD time is before the given time

parameters.name: locode
parameters.description: Return port calls for given locode

parameters.name: vesselName
parameters.description: Return port calls for given vessel name

parameters.name: mmsi
parameters.description: Return port calls for given mmsi

parameters.name: imo
parameters.description: Return port calls for given IMO/LLOYDS

parameters.name: nationality
parameters.description: Return port calls for vessels with given nationality

parameters.name: vesselTypeCode
parameters.description: Return port calls for given vessel type code

get.summary: Infos about apis data update times
get.description:
General information of API update intervals. Contains information about last updated time and how often should API to be called by client. 
For `dataUpdateInterval` field the `P0S` value has special meaning that data is updated nearly in real time. 
`null` value indicates static data and it is only updated when needed.

200.description: Successful retrieval of weather Station Feature Collections

get.summary: Return latest vessel metadata for all known vessels.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: From timestamp timestamp in milliseconds from Unix epoch 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To timestamp

get.summary: Return latest vessel metadata by mmsi.
Find latest vessel locations by mmsi and optional timestamp interval in milliseconds from Unix epoch.

parameters.name: mmsi
parameters.description: Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: From timestamp timestamp in milliseconds from Unix epoch 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To timestamp

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius of search circle in kilometers (km) using haversine formula.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude of the point

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude of the point

Type_Id.description:
Id of disturbance type:
1 - Lock malfunction
2 - Opening bridge malfunction
3 - Fairway restriction

virtualNavaids.description: Are there virtual navaids related to this warning

number.description: Nautical warning number. Starts with the digit 1 at the begining of the year. Set when warning was published

navaidInfo.description: Aids to navigation related to the nautical warning

navigationLineInfo.description: Navigation line features related to the nautical warning (separated by line breaks)

fairwayInfo.description: Fairway features related to the nautical warning (separated by line breaks)

coordinates.description: An array of coordinates. Coordinates are in WGS84 format in decimal degrees: [LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, {ALTITUDE}]. Altitude is optional and measured in meters.

items.description: An array of coordinates. Coordinates are in WGS84 format in decimal degrees: [LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, {ALTITUDE}]. Altitude is optional and measured in meters.

activityType.description: ('FRI','FREE') = 'Moving freely'; ('STL','STOP') = 'Stopped'; ('VLG','WAIT') = 'Waiting for icebreaker assistance'; ('HMN','PORT') = 'In port'; ('LED')        = 'Being led in a convoy'; ('BOG','TOW')  = 'Being towed'; ('VLH','WAIP') = 'Waiting for IB in port'; ('OVE','MON')  = 'Monitored'; ('DIR')        = 'Received waypoints'; ('NOT')        = 'Not active'; ('FFL','MOVE') = 'Moving'; ('LOK','LOC')  = 'Icebreaking locally'; ('ASS')        = 'Assisting ships'; ('OUT')        = 'Out of operation'; ('PLA')        = 'Planned assistance'; ('CCH')        = 'Planned crew change'; ('BUN')        = 'Planned bunkering'

beginTime.description: When the activity was started; the start of the validity period of the activity

endTime.description: When activity was ended (available only when querying past events); the end of the validity period of the activity

timestampBegin.description: When the begintime was entered into the source system

timestampEnd.description: When the endtime was entered into the source system

timestampCanceled.description: When an erroneous activity was canceled (if ever)

operatingIcebreakerPK.description: Key of icebreaker that is giving assistance (or supervising)

operatingIcebreakerName.description: Name of icebreaker that is giving assistance (or supervising)

operatedVesselPK.description: For icebreakers, key of ship that is being assisted (or supervised)

operatedVesselName.description: For icebreakers, name of ship that is being assisted (or supervised)

convoyOrder.description: Position in icebreaker convoy, if any (with 0 reserved for a towed ship); results should be given in this order

WinterNavigationShipActivityV1.description: Represents the ship state (or activity) given by icebreaker, VTS operator, winter navigation administrator, port authority or representative.

vesselId.description: Vessel identification code. Equals IMO-{IMO-code} when vessel IMO is present. Otherwise MMSI-{MMSI-code} (Maritime Mobile Service Identity).

activityType.description: PLA = Planned assistance CCH = Crew change BUN = Bunkering

plannedVesselPK.description: The target of the icebreaker plan

planningVesselPK.description: The icebreaker that is making this plan

ordering.description: Ordering of the planned assistances for this icebreaker

plannedWhen.description: Free text given for icebreaker's own activities "crew change" and "bunkering"

plannedWhere.description: Another free text for crew change and bunkering

planTimestamp.description: When the plan was made or changed

planTimestampRealized.description: When the plan was actualized (only available when retrieving past, historical events)

WinterNavigationShipPlannedActivityV1.description: Planned future assistance by an icebreaker or an icebreaker-specific activity like bunkering or crew change.

vesselId.description: Vessel identification code. Equals IMO-{IMO-code} when vessel IMO is present. Otherwise MMSI-{MMSI-code} (Maritime Mobile Service Identity).

length.description: Ship length from official ship register

width.description: Ship width from official ship register

aisLength.description: Ship length as entered into AIS device

aisWidth.description: Ship width as entered into AIS device

iceClass.description: IAS, IA, IB, IC, II, empty

shipActivities.description: Represents the ship state (or activity) given by icebreaker, VTS operator, winter navigation administrator, port authority or representative.

shipPlannedActivities.description: Planned future assistance by an icebreaker or an icebreaker-specific activity like bunkering or crew change.

aisDraught.description: Ship's current dynamic draught (entered into its own AIS device)

aisDestination.description: Destination text entered by ship into its own AIS transponder; often significantly different from what is available in ‚ÄúVoyage‚Äù section

movingSince.description: When the ship was observed to start moving

stoppedSince.description: When the ship was observed to having been stopped

inactiveSince.description: When the ship was no more observed / was deactivated from the system

WinterNavigationShipStateV1.description: Dynamically observed navigational status of the ship, originating either from the AIS network or from manual input by users. In IBNet terms, this element might also be called SHIPPASSAGE, POSITION or OBSERVATION.

fromLocode.description: UN locode of the previous port, if known

fromAtd.description: Actual Time of Departure, if known

inLocode.description: UN locode of the current port, if the ship is in harbour

inAta.description: Actual Time of Arrival to current port, if known

inEtd.description: Estimated Time of Departure to next destination, if known; note that may be confidential

destLocode.description: UN locode of the destination port, if known

destEta.description: Estimated Time of Arrival to destination, if known; note that may be confidential

WinterNavigationShipVoyageV1.description: Currently known and validated user-given information on the vessel's port-of-destination, port-of-residence, port-of-origin and/or previous and next ports. Note that this information is available in IBNet only if the ship has current or a future port visit to some Baltic Area port. In the general case, each event type (ETA, ATA, ETD, ATD) with their times, sources and timestamps, should be represented distinctly.

seaArea.description: Sea area where port is located

portRestrictions.description: Currently effective or announced traffic restrictions at the port

isCurrent.description: Indicates whether this restriction is currently in effect (true); false implies past/future restriction

portRestricted.description: Indicates whether traffic to this port is restricted (true) or not (false)

portClosed.description: Indicates if the port is closed due to extreme ice conditions; icebreaker assistance is not provided

lastModified.description: Date and time of last modification

validFrom.description:
Date when this restriction starts/started to be in effect; this is optional if isCurrent is true and
portRestricted is false, because during early winter ‚Äì when no restrictions yet exist ‚Äì the
past restriction data (end time of past season's last restriction) might not always be available

validUntil.description: Date when this restriction ceased to be in effect

rawText.description:
Raw text of the port traffic restriction.
Finnish-Swedish ice classes are IA Super, IA, IB, IC, II and I.
The number following the ice class code stands for minimum required ship deadweight tonnage.
'2000 t' in 'IA 4000 | 2000 t' code stands for minimum cargo the ship has to load or unload.

coordinates.description: Coordinates are in WGS84 format in decimal degrees: [LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, {ALTITUDE}]. Altitude is optional and measured in meters.

items.description: Coordinates are in WGS84 format in decimal degrees: [LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, {ALTITUDE}]. Altitude is optional and measured in meters.

issueTime.description: Time when the dirway was issued

validUntil.description: Date and time until this dirway was in effect

SseFeatureCollectionV1.description: GeoJSON FeatureCollection object of sea state estimate (SSE)

SseFeatureV1.description: GeoJSON Feature object of sea state estimate (SSE)

siteType.description: Type of the site. FLOATING is floating in the water and FIXED it is standing on the ground.

lastUpdate.description: Data last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 format with time offsets from UTC (eg. 2016-04-20T12:38:16.328+03:00 or 2018-11-09T09:41:09Z)

seaState.description: Sea state. If seaState is CALM, the windWaveDir is not reliable. This field is available only for FLOATING siteType

trend.description: Trend of condition change. This field is available only for FLOATING siteType

windWaveDir.description: Wind and wave direction in degrees from north. If seaState is CALM, the windWaveDir is not reliable. This field is available only for FLOATING siteType

confidence.description:
Provides information on estimated confidence of mainly the directional information based on the Horizontal Dilution of precision (HDOP) figure obtained from the GPS receiver:
* POOR: More than 10
* MODERATE: 2-10
* GOOD: Less than 2

heelAngle.description: Heel angle of the buoy in degrees (¬∞), 0 is upright and it¬¥s unsigned. This field is available only for FLOATING siteType

lightStatus.description: Status of the flashlight. Normally ON at nighttime and OFF at daytime. ON_D means that light characteristics are alternated (ie. intensity and frequency) compared to normal ON operation, used normally on daytime.

temperature.description: Temperature of the air in celsius degree (¬∞C). Since the sensor is inside of the buoy and sunlight can heat up the enclosure this can be used only as a reference measurement as it can show higher readings than the actual air temperature

SsePropertiesV1.description: GeoJSON Properties object of sea state estimate (SSE)

iceClassIssueDate.description: Date when ice class endorsement was issued

iceClassIssuePlace.description: Place where ice class endorsement was issued

iceClassEndDate.description: Date when ice class endorsement ends

doubleBottom.description: Tells whether vessel has a double bottom

inertGasSystem.description: Tells whether vessel has an Inert gas system

ballastTank.description: Tells whether vessel has a ballast tank

updateTimestamp.description: Timestamp of last vessel metadata update

dateOfIssue.description: Date when tonnage certificate was issued

PortLocationDtoV1.description: Ports, port areas and berths locations.

passangerListsOb.description: Number of passenger lists on board

healthDeclarationsOb.description: Number of health care declarations on board

imoGeneralDeclaration.description: Tells whether information concerns Departure or Arrival

briefParticularsVoyage.description: Brief particular information of voyage. Previous and following ports for example.

portOfDischarge.description: Code of port where discharge occurs

cargoDeclarationOb.description: Number of cargo declarations on board

crewListsOb.description: Number of crew lists on board

shipStoresDeclarationsOb.description: Number of ship store declarations on board

crewsEffectsDeclarationsOb.description: Number of crew effect declarations on board

eta.description: Estimated time of arrival. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

etaTimestamp.description: Update time of ETA. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

etd.description: Estimated time of departure. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

etdTimestamp.description: Update time of ETD. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

ata.description: Actual time of arrival. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

ataTimestamp.description: Update time of ATA. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

atd.description: Actual time of departure. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

atdTimestamp.description: Update time of ATD. Set by ship agent, port or pilot.

portToVisit.description: Code of the port to visit

arrivalWithCargo.description: Does the ship arrive with cargo

discharge.description:
Type of discharge
1: Unloads all cargo
2: Unloads part of cargo
3: Does not unload cargo
4: Ship arriving in ballast cargo

shipMasterArrival.description: Ship master at the moment of arrival(deprecated)

shipMasterDeparture.description: Ship master at the moment of departure(deprecated)

managementNameArrival.description: Ship management name at moment of arrival

managementNameDeparture.description: Ship management name at moment of departure

currentSecurityLevel.description: Current security level. 1 = normal security level, 2 = raised security level, 3 = exceptional security level

dataUpdatedTime.description: Timestamp when port calls were updated
Timestamp when metadata were last updated

CodeDescriptionsV1.description: Code descriptions associated with port calls

subtype.description: More specific info about API. Ie. domain info.

dataCheckedTime.description:
Latest check for data updates.
`null` value indicates data being pushed to our platform or static data that is only updated when needed.

dataUpdateInterval.description:
Data update interval in ISO-8601 duration format `PnDTnHnMn.nS`.
`P0S` means that data is updated in nearly real time.
`null` means that data is static and updated only when needed.

recommendedFetchInterval.description: Recommended fetch interval for clients in ISO-8601 duration format `PnDTnHnMn.nS`

UpdateInfoDtoV1.description: Info about API data updates (update intervals, last updated times)

UpdateInfosDtoV1.description: Info about API data updates (update intervals, last updated times)

name.description: Name of the vessel, maximum 20 characters using 6-bit ASCII

timestamp.description: Record timestamp in milliseconds from Unix epoch

draught.description: Maximum present static draught in 1/10m, 255 = draught 25.5 m or greater, 0 = not available (default)

eta.description:
Estimated time of arrival; MMDDHHMM UTC
Bits 19-16: month; 1-12; 0 = not available = default
Bits 15-11: day; 1-31; 0 = not available = default
Bits 10-6: hour; 0-23; 24 = not available = default
Bits 5-0: minute; 0-59; 60 = not available = default
For SAR aircraft, the use of this field may be decided by the responsible administration

posType.description:
Type of electronic position fixing device: 0 = undefined (default)
1 = GPS
2 = GLONASS
3 = combined GPS/GLONASS
4 = Loran-C
5 = Chayka
6 = integrated navigation system
7 = surveyed
8 = Galileo,
9-14 = not used
15 = internal GNSS

referencePointA.description: Reference point for reported position dimension A

referencePointB.description: Reference point for reported position dimension B

referencePointC.description: Reference point for reported position dimension C

referencePointD.description: Reference point for reported position dimension D

mmsi.description: Maritime Mobile Service Identity (nine digit identifier)
Maritime Mobile Service Identity (nine digit identifier)

sog.description: Speed over ground in knots, 102.3 = not available

cog.description: Course over ground in degrees, 360 = not available (default)

navStat.description:
Navigational status. 
Value range between 0 - 15. 
0 = under way using engine, 
1 = at anchor, 
2 = not under command, 
3 = restricted maneuverability, 
4 = constrained by her draught, 
5 = moored, 
6 = aground, 
7 = engaged in fishing, 
8 = under way sailing, 
9 = reserved for future amendment of navigational status for ships carrying DG, HS, or MP, or IMO hazard or pollutant category C, high speed craft (HSC), 
10 = reserved for future amendment of navigational status for ships carrying dangerous goods (DG), harmful substances (HS) or marine pollutants (MP), or IMO hazard or pollutant category A, wing in ground (WIG), 
11 = power-driven vessel towing astern (regional use),
12 = power-driven vessel pushing ahead or towing alongside (regional use), 
13 = reserved for future use, 
14 = AIS-SART (active), MOB-AIS, EPIRB-AIS, 
15 = default

rot.description:
Rate of turn, ROT[AIS]. 
Values range between -128 - 127. ‚Äì128 indicates that value is not available (default).
Coded by ROT[AIS] = 4.733 SQRT(ROT[IND]) where ROT[IND] is the Rate of Turn degrees per minute, as indicated by an external sensor. 
+127 = turning right at 720 degrees per minute or higher
-127 = turning left at 720 degrees per minute or higher.

raim.description: Receiver autonomous integrity monitoring (RAIM) flag of electronic position fixing device

timestamp.description:
UTC second when the report was generated by the electronic position system (EPFS). 
Values: 
0-59 UTC second, 
60 if time stamp is not available, which should also be the default value, 
61 if positioning system is in manual input mode, 
62 if electronic position fixing system operates in estimated (dead reckoning) mode, 
63 if the positioning system is inoperative)

timestampExternal.description: Location record timestamp in milliseconds from Unix epoch.
